instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus @ 8.2v no light on the charger
threads.message: Board had some corrosion around SMC (<RESISTOR>R5283</RESISTOR> area) some traces were gone, I made them nice again with wire and tested for proper connection (<RESISTOR>R5283</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R5296</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R5185</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R5021</RESISTOR>) all those pads were pretty bad, I gave the SMC a good reflow as it looked like the corrosion did not get under it, but still no light on the charger and ppbus is 8.2v, <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> is 3.42v at pin 12 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, resistance to ground on ppbus is 0.143 measured in diode mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus @ 8.2v no light on the charger
threads.message: <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> voltage? This sounds like bad SMC to me

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus @ 8.2v no light on the charger
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus @ 8.2v no light on the charger
threads.message: Try new SMC. Must come from 3437 donor board

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus @ 8.2v no light on the charger
threads.message: Will do, I have a donor

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus @ 8.2v no light on the charger
threads.message: Reball SMC first, this could be good enough.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> ppbus @ 8.2v no light on the charger
threads.message: There was a little bit of corrosion under the SMC, so reballing it did the trick. Muchas gracias!
